result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Bernard F Szabrowicz was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 6 days served.

superMiscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. FINE PAID IN FULL.

BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD DRAW FEES.
Blood costs to be forwarded to the Waukesha Sheriff's Dept.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Do not operate unless properly licensed.
Refund remaining bail to defendant after applying to fine and all costs.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance to the Victim Impact Panel was already completed.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bernard F Szabrowicz in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed outright. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 6 days)
  -  5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel:  already completed
*Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $25.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department);

FINE:  $2023.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute)

RESTITUTION:  "0"

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
